result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tanner Lee Michener in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:17 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count's 2-4 are DRI.  Clerk directed to withhold the entry of Judgment of Conviction this date as defendant to be placed in the VIP Program.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Placed in VIP Program for a period of 9 months
Comply with conditions as listed on the VIP Risk Assessment and Recommendations Report:
40 hours of Community Service 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in other community based services as determined as appropriate by the VIP Program Director.
Participate in ACS Groups/Day Report at a level determined by the VIP Case Manager.
If successfully completes the VIP Program will be dismissed.

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - DRI

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 


BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Tanner Lee Michener in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:35 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Do not possess/consume illegal drugs or controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances unlawfully.

Defendant Tanner Lee Michener in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
